The time for one emission is 1μs and the interval between emissions is 100μs.
ab = bc indicates that the time for the wave to travel to the obstacle and back is equal to the interval between emissions.
The total time for the round trip is 100μs.
The one-way travel time is half of the round trip time, which is 50μs.
The distance is calculated using the formula distance = speed × time.
The speed of light is 3.0×10^8 m/s.
